item.title: Really Simple Syndication, or RSS
item.description:
Podcasts are nice. They show up in chronological order, download in the background, and work the same in every app. In a world of algorithmic walled garden social “platforms”, this is a miracle.

Why can’t more of the internet be like that? As Yair Rosenberg wrote in 2023, you can take back control of what you see on the internet.

It’s just RSS

The technology of a hopeful future actually came out in 1999. It’s just RSS. Every morning I fire up NetNewsWire. God Himself cannot tamper with the sanctity or sort order of my feed. I pick something, open it up, and read it. Nobody tracks me. There are no cookie policies to accept. There’s no like button or comment section.

item.title: I want to get off Mr. Bones' Wild Ride
item.description:
In June of ‘25 I shut off most of my social media accounts: Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn. I kept reddit under the happy delusion that I could learn to use it responsibly (lol).

Since then, I’ve often thought about what the experience of being “on the internet” is like, and how that’s changed since I began forming digital habits back in High School. My memory is relatively poor, so a habit-forming tool for capturing a bit of life is wonderful. Having my good intentions packaged up to generate ad revenue and give teenagers an anxiety disorder is less so. 10% of Meta’s revenue for 2024 came from fraud.
